books.title: The Able McLaughlins
books.author: Margaret Wilson
books.summary: The eldest son of Scottish immigrants farming the Iowa prairie struggles to help his soon-to-be wife recover from the violent act that could ruin both of their lives.

books.title: The Master of Ballantrae
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: The relationship of two noble brothers is blighted by hostility and vengeance in Jacobite Scotland.

books.title: Geronimo’s Story of His Life
books.author: Geronimo
books.summary: The Apache war chief Geronimo recounts the story of his life.

books.title: Tombstone
books.author: Walter Noble Burns
books.summary: An embellished retelling of the town of Tombstone, Arizona, during its heyday in the late 19th century, featuring famous heroes and outlaws of the American Old West.

books.title: Indian Fairy Tales
books.author: Joseph Jacobs
books.summary: A collection of fairy tales that exhibits India’s rich folk tale tradition.

books.title: Mr. Mulliner Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of short stories featuring the eccentric (and hilarious) Mr. Mulliner, who regales the patrons of the Anglers’ Rest with tales of his colorful and amusing relatives.

books.title: The Merchant of Venice
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: To help his friend Bassanio woo the beautiful Portia, the Venetian merchant Antonio borrows a large sum from Shylock, a Jewish moneylender.

books.title: The Phoenix and the Carpet
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: Five children once again encounter an ancient, magical creature and go on adventures around the world with its magic carpet.

books.title: Greenmantle
books.author: John Buchan
books.summary: The story of a chase through war-torn Europe to prevent an uprising during the First World War.

books.title: The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A London lawyer investigates the relationship between a brilliant scientist and a misshapen misanthrope.

books.title: My Four Weeks in France
books.author: Ring Lardner
books.summary: A sports columnist and humorist travels to France as a war correspondent during World War I and recounts his experiences on the assignment.

books.title: The Valley of Fear
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The final novel in Sir Arthur Conan Doyle’s Sherlock Holmes series follows the eponymous hero as he investigates a Sussex murder seemingly connected with a secret society.

books.title: Progress and Poverty
books.author: Henry George
books.summary: An explanation on why increased productivity has not led to increased wages, and how the application of a single land value tax can fix this and lead to a more just society.

books.title: Pragmatism
books.author: William James
books.summary: James introduces the philosophy of pragmatism and applies it to some metaphysical problems.

books.title: The Iliad
books.author: Homer
books.summary: The epic poem which follows a Greek warrior who refuses to give up his prize of war.

books.title: The Mercy of Allah
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: An entrepreneurial businessman satirically relates to his nephews how he became the wealthiest man in Baghdad.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Frederik Pohl
books.summary: A collection of science fiction stories by Frederik Pohl ordered by date of publication.

books.title: While the Billy Boils
books.author: Henry Lawson
books.summary: A short story collection based on Australian colonial life in 1890s.

books.title: A Confession
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: A brief meditation on depression, philosophy, religion, and the meaning of life.

books.title: The Cruise of the Alerte
books.author: E. F. Knight
books.summary: An English journalist sets sail in search of treasure buried on a remote desert island.
